pullRequest.body:
This PR extends the Hales-Jewett theorem from combinatorial lines to higher-dimensional combinatorial subspaces. It's an example of a theorem proving its own generalisation.

Co-authored-by: David WÃ¤rn

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
- [x] depends on: #13725
- [x] depends on: #13988

The plan is to eventually use this to prove existence of monochromatic `(m, p, c)`-sets.

Ported from https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/11305

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10061955086/job/27813254880)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10061955086/job/27813254489)

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion âˆƒ n, âˆ€ C : (Fin n â†’ Î±) â†’ Îº, âˆƒ l : Subspace Î· Î± (Fin n), l.IsMono C := by ```
This section seems redundant

```suggestion
  specialize hÎ¹ (fun x â†¦ C <| fun (i, e) â†¦ x i <| (equivShrink.{0} Î·).symm e)
```
and below
Are all of these universe annotations really needed? :(
Yes, for unification ðŸ˜¢
Could combine these if you want
My reading of this was that subspaces are defined in `Mathlib/Combinatorics/Subspace.lean`. Maybe "defined as" instead?
These two in combination are a bad idea; only the latter should exist
Can you redefine `Line` as `Subspace Unit` to avoid duplication?

I doubt that's a great idea because `Subspace Unit Î± Î¹` coerces to functions `(Unit â†’ Î±) â†’ Î¹ â†’ Î±` while `Line Î± Î¹` coerces to functions `Î± â†’ Î¹ â†’ Î±`. There's not that much duplication to avoid anyway.
Same as above, now both `FunLike.coe` and `(l.idxFun i).elim id xâŸ©` are valid coercions, and syntactically they're different.
Is there a `Line.toSubspace` definition hiding here?
There was, but damn that was not easy.
I find it quite hard to believe this doesn't already exist.
Me too, but we do have the `existsUnique` and `forall` versions in `Logic.Equiv.Defs`.

Do you have a reference for this notion of subspace? (The file should have references to mathematical texts, I believe, so that people can compare this formalization with papers/textbooks presentations.)

In particular, I am troubled by the addition of `proper` within the structure.
I would prefer a `Proper` or `Nontrivial`predicateâ€¦
Suggestion : "for all directions `e : Î·`, `fun x â†¦ x e` is `fun x â†¦ l x i` for at least one coordinate `i`"
This notion of subspace is a direct generalisation of the notion of lines in this file. If you don't have the `proper` field, then your subspaces needn't be `Î·`-dimensional.

The terminology "combinatorial subspace" / "subspace" is standard when discussing this theorem. I was roughly following lecture notes essentially the same as these: https://tartarus.org/gareth/maths/notes/iii/Ramsey_Theory.pdf, where you can find this terminology. (And yes, without the `proper` field, you don't get a *sub*space, rather you get something like a non-injective map from a cube.)
IsMonochromatic would be better, because `mono` is often used for `monotone`.
Maybe it's worth renaming, but that's out of scope for this PR. `Combinatorics.Line.IsMono` already exists.
Can you explicit these two possible coercions in the comment?
What do you mean? The two coercions are defeq, but one is wrapped in `FunLike.coe`.

I didn't understand what you meant exactly. 
Just write what these coercions are, mathematically, or syntactically.
Better now?
Is a `Line` a `Subspace`. (And the predicate `nontrivial` would be meaningful here.)
Well, a `Line` can be considered as a `Subspace` via `Line.toSubspaceUnit`. Is this what you mean? I don't understand your `nontrivial` comment.

```suggestion
/-- The **extended Hales-Jewett theorem**, also known as the **multidimensional Hales-Jewett theorem**: For any finite types `Î·`, `Î±` and `Îº`, there exists a
```
"Multidimenensional" is more descriptive, and both seem to appear in the literature (see e.g. http://dx.doi.org/10.4007/annals.2012.175.3.6)
You are right, I prefer "multidimensional" over "extended".

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion ```

```suggestion
open scoped Classical
```

```suggestion
  idxFun i := (l.idxFun <| eÎ¹.symm i).map eÎ± eÎ·
```
> while `$` is a synonym for `<|`, its use in mathlib is disallowed in favor of `<|`

from [here](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style.html#whitespace-and-delimiters).

```suggestion
  f.exists_congr_left.trans <| by simp [h]
  
```
Sorry, this is in #13725
Isn't this file also in another PR of yours?
Yes sorry, I forgot to record the dependency on #13988

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Combinatorial subspaces and multidimensional Hales-Jewett
